author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
Air traffic controllers for Newark Liberty International Airport recently experienced several frightening incidents. Their radars and radios have gone dark, potentially risking the lives of hundreds of passengers.⁠
⁠
United Airlines CEO Scott Kirby said that workers taking trauma leave had made the staffing situation at Newark worse. He described controllers as having "walked off the job."⁠
⁠
In an exclusive interview with WSJ, one veteran air-traffic controller opens up about his own close call and the reasons for stress-related trauma leave.⁠

#ATC #Aviation #Shorts
title: Air-Traffic Controller Opens Up About Trauma on the Job
